basic_info.description: ðŸ‘‹ I'm Andrew Enyeart, a software developer with a diverse background including firefighting, linguistics, education, and most recently, bartending. I decided to pivot from bartending to coding because for me, the most magical aspect of being human is the experience of figuring out how things work, and I was hungry for the intellectual challenges that coding provides. I love how focused my mind becomes when I'm solving interesting coding problems, and I work best when I can do deep work independently followed by collaboration with others. I'd love to work in an environment that capitalizes on my critical analysis, attention to detail, customer empathy, and the communication skills I've cultivated from the many customer-facing roles I've held.

projects.title: Tipplr
projects.description: 'Know what drinks to make with what you have'â€“Tipplr is an application that enables the user to filter a list of cocktail recipes based on what they actually have on hand, add their own recipes, and get recommendations on the next bottle they should add to their collection to significantly increase the number of cocktails they can make at home.

projects.title: Beasty
projects.description: A just-for-fun React application built with Bootstrap components that displays a variety of horned animals, allowing the user to filter based on number of horns.

projects.title: 3D Object Viewer
projects.description: One of the first apps I was working on my internship. I had to develop front-end implementation for app that shows 3D models of known buildings. This was also my first project in Angular framework. I've learned a lot!
